component.name: message
component.description: Root tag of a mail message.

attribute.name: importance
attribute.description: low, normal or high. By default normal, this sets the importance of the mail message.

attribute.name: precedence
attribute.description: Sets the precedence of the message.

attribute.name: requestReadReceipt
attribute.description: By default false, if set, a read receipt request will be will be added, with the read receipt being sent to the From: address.

attribute.name: urlBase
attribute.description: If set, the value is prepended to the requestContextPath allowing you to use components such as h:graphicImage in your emails.

component.name: from
component.description: Set's the From: address for the email. You can only have one of these per email.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name the email should come from.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The email address the email should come from.

component.name: replyTo
component.description: Set's the Reply-to: address for the email. You can only have one of these per email.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The email address the email should come from.

component.name: to
component.description: Add a recipient to the email. Use multiple m:to tags for multiple recipients. This tag can be safely placed inside a repeat tag such as ui:repeat.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The email address of the recipient.

component.name: cc
component.description: Add a cc recipient to the email. Use multiple m:cc tags for multiple ccs. This tag can be safely placed inside a iterator tag such as ui:repeat.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The email address of the recipient.

component.name: bcc
component.description: Add a bcc recipient to the email. Use multiple m:bcc tags for multiple bccs. This tag can be safely placed inside a repeat tag such as ui:repeat.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: The email address of the recipient.

component.name: header
component.description: Add a header to the email.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the header to add.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The value of the header to add.

component.name: attachment
component.description: Add an attachment to the email.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The file to attach: - String — A String is interpreted as a path to file within the classpath - java.io.File — An EL expression can reference a File object - java.net.URL — An EL expression can reference a URL object - java.io.InputStream — An EL expression can reference an InputStream. In this case both a fileName and a contentType must be specified. - byte[] — An EL expression can reference an byte[]. In this case both a fileName and a contentType must be specified.

attribute.name: fileName
attribute.description: Specify the file name to use for the attached file.

attribute.name: contentType
attribute.description: Specify the MIME type of the attached file.

component.name: subject
component.description: Set's the subject for the email.

component.name: body
component.description: Set's the body for the email. Supports an alternative facet which, if an HTML email is generated can contain alternative text for a mail reader which doesn't support html.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: If set to plain then a plain text email will be generated otherwise an HTML email is generated.
